title: 107_hr2313
content: The Act may be cited as the "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" and repeals the taxation of corporations. The "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" repeals various provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to corporate taxation. SEC. 3. 10 PERCENT INCOME TAX RATE FOR INDIVIDUALS. Amendment to Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose a 10 percent income tax rate for individuals. A 10 percent income tax rate is imposed on individuals based on the excess of earned income over the exemption amount, which is $10,000 adjusted for the cost of living. The cost-of-living adjustment is calculated based on the Consumer Price Index for October of the preceding year compared to October 2000. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) for all-urban consumers, published by the Department of Labor, is used to calculate cost-of-living adjustments for earned income. If the adjustment is not a multiple of $10, it is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Earned income includes wages, self-employment earnings, and qualifying dividends. Earned income for tax purposes includes wages, self-employment earnings, and qualifying dividends. It does not include pension or annuity payments, tips at the discretion of the recipient, or fringe benefits valued at the employer's cost. SEC. 4. Amnesty for all prior tax liability before January 1, 2000, with exceptions for amounts paid before enactment and taxes related to illegal activities. SEC. 5. Repeal of special deductions, credits, and exclusions from income for individuals. SEC. 6. Repeal of estate and gift taxes. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES. Subtitle B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed. Effective dates apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment date. Repeal applies to estates of decedents dying after enactment. Secretary of the Treasury to submit technical changes to reflect the law changes.
